brainly_data.question:
How does "I Sit and Look Out" contrast with "I Hear America Singing"? 

A. It shows the upper class of America, whereas the other poem shows the working class.
B. It shows the worst of America, whereas the other poem shows the best of America.
C. It uses a defined rhyme scheme, whereas the other poem is written in free verse.
D. It shows a love story, whereas the other poem only discusses work. 
i need help plzzzz :(
brainly_data.subject: History

all_answers.question:
How does "I Sit and Look Out" contrast with "I Hear America Singing"? 

A. It shows the upper class of America, whereas the other poem shows the working class.
B. It shows the worst of America, whereas the other poem shows the best of America.
C. It uses a defined rhyme scheme, whereas the other poem is written in free verse.
D. It shows a love story, whereas the other poem only discusses work. 
i need help plzzzz :(
all_answers.subject: History
all_answers.text:
It has to be D - It shows a love story, whereas the other poem only discusses work.
